message.body: Hey ya
What's the story with u r username?
How are things today?
Haha so I'm pretty bad at picking creative usernames, and for some reason that line from the chorus of 'That's Not My Name' came to mind.
But I'm pretty good. Ran some errands and now off to see some friends. How about you?
I'm at the coffee shop because there is no food at my house.
What errands did you take on today
Just rode my bike home to do some work stuff.

Oh I hate it when that happens. My mom stopped cooking when I went to college, so real food is often scarce when I'm home. I had to pick up stuff for myfriend's wedding on Saturday. What work do you do?
All kinds of work some construction, art, linguistics, but the art is my favorite but doesn't pay to well
Do you like going to weddings
Do you live with your mom? Do you cook now or does your mom cook?
I like to cook a lot but I don't have the time to do it as much as I like and in the summer when it's hot it's not as much fun to be in the kitchen

Mm gotcha. Yea weddings are fun if people I know are going. I love cooking actually...I end up baking more when I have lots of time though. Well I just graduated from college and am home for part of the summer before grad school.
I never liked weddings that much until all my friends started getting married. Now I do like them most of the time.
It's cool that you like to bake, it can be difficult. I like to bake buttermilk biscuits but can't bake much more than that.
The biscuits are good though.
What r u going to grad school for?
Well yea..as a kid one is kinda just dragged along
Biscuits are always a win. I'm going to get a master's in social work
Where are you from?
That's great
Originally I'm from upstate ny. You?
I hear penn and smith have good social work programs for the east coast anyway
Northern virginia. Yea I got into Penn and was considering it. I liked certain things about it for sure, but I ended up choosing Boston College. What kind of art do you do?
I make all kinds of art. Painting sculpture sound ... I am casting things from pet hair at the moment for part of an installation in a couple of weeks.
What kind stuff do you do in your spare time? Got any plans for this summer before you get loaded down with studies

Oh wow, that is fascinating! In college I was in a chorus, but I probly won't do any formal singing from here on out. Yea I'm going to Brazil and argentina with family before my sister studies abroad and to Bermuda to see family. Are you taking any vacation?
I am taking a trip in July to Minneapolis to get a root canal so it's probably not going to be quite as exciting or fun as brazil and Argentina
My friend was just in Argentina for a week with is family, dove hunting , of all things
Ooh heck! Not fun. I actually just got my wisdom teeth taken out. Not quite the same, but still in the catgory of unpleasant.
No kidding! Never knew that was the thing to do in Argentina...
Ugg I got all 4 wisdom teeth out when 1 was impacted and it was an extreme experience
Yeah I didn't know that about Argentina either
What are your plans for brazil?
That sounds exciting
Haha yea. I'm actually still taking pain killers because every once in a while the jaw still gets pretty sore. Amazon village, Rio, and Iguazu!
Can't wait
Question: do you have any preferred convo partners in this study?
And why don't you think you'll sing anymore? Are you just over it? Or is it a time issue
And if yes, do you ever get to talk to them?
Yes I do and I get to talk to them on occasion
Just have your call partner set up their available time at a weird time like starting at 10:22 and you do the same.
The trick I think is to have a day off with no text time scheduled before the days you call up on so you are not still in the 24 hour conversation at thetime you and your friend signed up for.
Otherwise you will be stuck texting boring randos like me
I love singing, but there wont really be time for it with school, etc.
Ahhhhh you've really thought this out! That makes sense.
I need to work on the coordination of schedules better
Yeah the coordination doesn't work all the time but will probably work most of the time if you follow those rules.
So what kinda stuff do you like to sing? Gospel, punk, grindcore, rap, jazz, Gregorian chant, oratorio sung through vocoders or all of the above mashed up into one short bluegrass song?
Haha that would be intense. What do I LIKE to sing. Hmm, I mean, I guess to whatever you can harmonize easily enough to or just has good vocals in general. What do you listen to mostly?
Mostly, rock I guess probably 70s early metal stuff. But like most people I like a wide range of stuff.
How about you what do you listen to mostly
Electronic music mostly. And I like instrumental stuff and some more folksy stuff
Do you ever watch arrested development? Have you seen the new season
I saw through episode 7 but never got around to finishing the episode. I've seen random episodes from other seasons but not all the way through. Dis yousee all of season 4? What did you think?
I haven't seem the new season, that's what I wanted to ask you about because I've heard mixed reviews.
I was wondering if it was worth watching

Ah. Well, the people who I watched it with (and i) thought that it was quite different from earlier seasons. It had a wackiness that is kinda hard yo describe. I had a harder time keeping up with what it was trying to do kinda
But I also didn't finish the season, so I'm not sure how it tied together at the end...
I like wacky, maybe I'll check it out.
In general I do too. There were definitely some really funny parts.

Do you know if it still has the same writers in season 4 do you? The writing was real smart and played the long game with a lot of jokes, it would be a shame if they tried to duplicate that with new writers.
I have no idea....I didn't hear anything of the sort, so my guess is that they are the same.
That's good to hear.
So what made you want to get into social work
Desire to do good in the world and use my Spanish skills for service; appreciation for its interdisciplinary nature, variety, and its stated values; and
its coherence with my faith
Those are really good reasons!
It's nice to hear that people are still genuinely trying to do good out there, everything in the media seems to suggest the opposite.
It's nice to hear that you are so sure of what you want to do and it is helping people
I don't think I could deal with the emotional wear and tear of a profession like that
You must be a very strong person

Well thanks, that is nice of you to say. I believe in the worthiness of the profession, although the world doesn't really value it. I will admit that myheart and my head tell me different things when it comes to whether I'm making a good decision. Nevertheless, like you said, I am sure that I want to help people.
Well it's good that you are guided by your heart. Your head will most likely follow. ;)
